titleInfo.title: 5-161 Irwin Village Site 12CP5, Campbell County, Tennessee. Mound 1. Feature 15, Circular clay fireplace

mods.abstract: On the NE side of this fire place is a partial cleft or shelf. This was not cut with a shovel. The excavation was made from the south side and the workmen's shovel cut a small niche in this end. Pit in center is 18" in diameter and circular. The width along the outer border of the niche is 18" and extends inward for 13". From bottom which was on humus line extending downward to the hardpan was a 9" layer of mixed clay and humus. After demolishing fireplace a circular pit was found underneath of the following dimensions 3' E.W. - 2' N.S. and 2 feet deep. In this were potsherds, and burned fragments of animal bone mixed with ash and charcoal. A large stone was found associated with niche on northeast side of fireplace. It is possible that stone fitted into niche or was dropped on fireplace causing area to be broken out. See photo 5-161 for relationship of stone to niche as fireplace was uncovered.
mods.note: Observer illustration is on file at the institution. See also photographs 5-206 [fhm00555], and 5-219 [fhm00556]
